creditline: Gift of Mrs. Harry A. Bullis
description: silver footed slaver with moulded rim and coat of arms
inscription:
Mark and Inscription

-The center engrave with the armorials of an unidentified widow composed of a chevron between or within three roses barbed, impaling a chevron between or within three garbs, the whole in a baroque cartouche.  On the underside the pricked initials and date:  
     [E.E.W]
     [1717]
Also on the underside is a modern applied rectangular silver plaque engraved with the following inscription:
   [To Harry A. Bullis, from the Members of the Board, General Mills, Inc., With Deep Admiration and Affection, December 31st, 1958]
markings:
Mark

-Fully marked (Britannia standard) on upper side of salver.  Lion\'s head erased on underside of foot.
title: Footed salver
